get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve the list of enabled bank accounts for payouts. 
The list of bank accounts indicates which accounts are eligible for receiving payout transactions.OData is a standardized protocol for building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Supported query parameters are: 
- $filter: Filter the payments based on specific criteria.
- $orderby: Specify the sorting order for the payments.
- $top: Limit the maximum number of payments to retrieve.
- $skip: Specify the number of payments to skip from the beginning.
Note: This endpoint supports pagination using the $top and $skip parameters.

count.description: Total Number of records available for the filter
Total Number of records available for the filter
Total Number of records available for the filter

put.description:
This API endpoint allows you to capture funds from a previously pre-authorized payment. 
Once a payment has been preauthorized, use this method to 
initiate the capturing of the authorized funds.

amount.description: Full or Partial Amount to capture
Full or Partial Amount to capture
Full or Partial Amount to capture

get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve payments using OData query parameters. 
OData is a standardized protocol for building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Supported query parameters are: 
- $filter: Filter the payments based on specific criteria.
- $orderby: Specify the sorting order for the payments.
- $top: Limit the maximum number of payments to retrieve.
- $skip: Specify the number of payments to skip from the beginning.
Note: This endpoint supports pagination using the $top and $skip parameters.

preauthorize.description: Block amount - True, Instant capture - False

googlePay.description: True - Allow GPay payment, False - Restrict GPay payment

applePay.description: True - Allow ApplePay payment, False - Restrict ApplePay payment

webhookGateway.description: Payze will HTTP POST payment updates to this API URL

successRedirectGateway.description: Cardholder will be redirected to this URL after successful payment; For payment gateways only

errorRedirectGateway.description: Cardholder will be redirected to this URL after failed payment; For payment gateways only

channel.description: Payment sale channel, eg. WEB, MOBILE, POS, PARTNERS etc.

productCode.description: Legal code of goods and services, AKA. IKPU

sumPrice.description: The total amount of the position, taking into account the quantity and excluding discounts

commissionInfoTin.description: TIN (if the principal is a legal entity)

commissionInfoPinfl.description: PINFL (if the principal is an individual)

extraAttributes.description: Extra attribute dictionary to add custom parameters or metadata to the payment

email.description: Payment link will be send to the email specified

smsPhone.description: Payment link will be send to the phone specified, extra charges apply

get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve payments using OData query parameters 
not limiting to token.company id. 
OData is a standardized protocol for building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Supported query parameters are: 
- $filter: Filter the payments based on specific criteria.
- $orderby: Specify the sorting order for the payments.
- $top: Limit the maximum number of payments to retrieve.
- $skip: Specify the number of payments to skip from the beginning.
Note: This endpoint supports pagination using the $top and $skip parameters.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve the payment receipt.

put.description:
This API endpoint allows you to update payment receipts. 
Users who use OFD on their side can upload payment receipts using this endpoint.

This API endpoint allows merchants to securely process 
payments like Just-Pay, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and Save Card. 
This endpoint simplifies payment integration by providing parameters for customer information,payment details, and authentication tokens. 
It supports holding funds with pre-authorization, 
and ensures secure transactions using card tokenization. 
HTTP PUT honors request idempotency, Ensuring that 
sending the same request multiple times has the same effect as sending it once.

idempotencyKey.description: A unique identifier that ensures a payment request is only processed once.

preauthorize.description: False - Instant capture; True - Block with pre-authorisation

tokenizeCard.description: False - Will not tokenize card; True - Card will be tokenized for future payments

applePay.description: True - Allow ApplePay payment, False - Restrict ApplePay payment

webhookGateway.description: Payze will HTTP POST payment updates to this API URL

successRedirectGateway.description: Cardholder will be redirected to this URL after successful payment; For payment gateways only

errorRedirectGateway.description: Cardholder will be redirected to this URL after failed payment; For payment gateways only

channel.description: Payment sale channel, eg. WEB, MOBILE, POS, PARTNERS etc.

productCode.description: Legal code of goods and services, AKA. IKPU

sumPrice.description: The total amount of the position, taking into account the quantity and excluding discounts

commissionInfoTin.description: TIN (if the principal is a legal entity)

commissionInfoPinfl.description: PINFL (if the principal is an individual)

extraAttributes.description: Extra attribute dictionary to add custom parameters or metadata to the payment

ownerPersonalId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner owner tax id will be used

ownerTaxId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner personal id will be used

delayPayoutDays.description: Provided value delays split payout by days

payoutSplit.description: Fill PayoutSplit to split payment amount between multiple bank accounts

email.description: Payment link will be send to the email specified

smsPhone.description: Payment link will be send to the phone specified, extra charges apply

token.description: Card token for previously tokenized payments

put.description:
This API endpoint allows you to initiate a partial or full refunds for a previous payment transaction. 
By providing the Transaction ID and necessary details, 
you can request a refund for a specific payment.
HTTP PUT honors request idempotency, Ensuring that 
sending the same request multiple times has the same effect as sending it once.

amount.description: Full or Partial Amount to refund

idempotencyKey.description: A unique identifier that ensures a request is only processed once.

put.description:
This API endpoint allows you to update refund receipts. 
Users who use OFD on their side can upload refund receipts using this endpoint.

This API method allows you to modify the payout splits for a specific payment. 
Payout splits define how the payment amount is distributed among different recipients. 
It supports payments that have already been created with splits. 
Please, note that modifications to the split are only supported 
until the final scheduled payment is paid out;  
HTTP PUT honors request idempotency, Ensuring that 
sending the same request multiple times has the same effect as sending it once.

idempotencyKey.description: A unique identifier that ensures a payment request is only processed once.

ownerPersonalId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner owner tax id will be used

ownerTaxId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner personal id will be used

delayPayoutDays.description: Provided value delays split payout by days

get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve payment split data using OData queries. 
OData is a standardized protocol for building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Supported query parameters are: 
- $filter: Filter the resource based on specific criteria.
- $orderby: Specify the sorting order for the resource.
- $top: Limit the maximum number of resources to retrieve.
- $skip: Specify the number of resources to skip from the beginning.
Note: This endpoint supports pagination using the $top and $skip parameters.

ownerPersonalId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner owner tax id will be used

ownerTaxId.description: Account owner tax id, if not specified, owner personal id will be used

delayPayoutDays.description: Provided value delays split payout by days

put.description:
This API endpoint cancels all pending and scheduled splits for the payment. 
Split cancellation is allowed until the last scheduled split has been paid out.

post.description:
This API endpoint allows you to request an available balance payout to a bank account. 
The payout is initiated from the available balance in the company's account. 
Please not this method does not support Idempotency.

amount.description: Amount to payout from available balance

currency.description: Account with provided currency will be used for the payouts

amount.description: Amount to payout from available balance

currency.description: Account with provided currency will be used for the payouts

amount.description: Amount to payout from available balance

currency.description: Account with provided currency will be used for the payouts

get.description:
This API endpoint allows you to retrieve the status and data about previously requested payouts. 
OData is a standardized protocol for building and consuming RESTful APIs.
Supported query parameters are: 
- $filter: Filter the resource based on specific criteria.
- $orderby: Specify the sorting order for the resource.
- $top: Limit the maximum number of resources to retrieve.
- $skip: Specify the number of resources to skip from the beginning.
Note: This endpoint supports pagination using the $top and $skip parameters.
